lCoqtkDCY90IckQjOjawbA.text: I love black diner! Every time I travel this is my go to breakfast place. No matter what I always check and see if there is one near to where I am. Food is always consistent and staff is always friendly and welcoming. Food portions are huge!

t84mniR09oU0ualdpDt6-g.text: Best coffee!!! Great breakfast!  We have to bring home half. We went out for pie and coffee with friends. We were surprised at the mini pie in a bowl we each got!!!!

k5lIVa5fZCGmPq-dwurYQw.text: This was my second time dining with this company. The first time I ate at another location but wasn't impressed.  I went back because some friends from work where going there for lunch.  I'm happy to say that I really liked my chicken club and my friends all enjoyed their meals.  Vast improvement from my first experience.  The staff were awesome. Our waitress rocked.  She was happy smiling and was on top of it.  Our glasses were never in need of water nor were my friends cups ever void of coffee.  Big portions and great French fries.  I love the super fast service!  It's so important when you're on your lunch break.  We split the bill which they had no problem doing and we're heading back to work with a belly full of goodness.  I will come back to this location again.  Thank you for a great experience.

ce8b-bjh2hIL1BJFYCNOMQ.text: Black Bear is always an awesome place to dine- in for breakfast! Our server Shandi made it a memorable experience. It's because of her that she made it five stars!

156x47QaOLEHBUpfncBvoA.text: Food and service were great!!! Our waitress Joanna was the best!!!! We will definitely be back.

0z_jEkzx0FUqhZ-kB7X9fQ.text: Best breakfast ever! Large portions, went twice during our stay on the strip... service is on point!

TwKbdMDXa1wmlc1EvXVeUA.text: This is a gem!! If you're looking for friendly staff and good food that's fresh, go here. They care about the products the serve you, from the ketchup to the jam, they use healthier ingredients, they pay more for it, which tells me they care about my experience. I like the branding and I appreciate our service, Yessi was helpful and very nice. You need to put one of these in northern Colorado around Fort Collins! It would do so well and then I can eat here more than once in a while. Thanks Black Bear Diner- you started my day right!

bHp_aHvUAnTLXu2OZKWwwg.text: We just happened to stop here for breakfast after seeing a billboard advertisement and we were not disappointed. The food was great, huge portions, and the service was excellent. Our server, Salvador, was awesome!

oolrZ-CfbNCU7FKJfZ_hUQ.text: Nichole was amazing! She was super accommodating to all my requests! Super yummy pancakes and the syrup was nice and warm! The eggs were cooked perfectly and he bacon was crispy. Just perfect! Thanks for a delicious breakfast!

kTqlsnbviQLeZa0jI2-nnQ.text: Not great. Music was WAY too loud for breakfast time. Wow. I just couldn't get away from it. I'm ok with country music, but it was really distracting. Food was mediocre at best, service was good.

MlLD8VzpudItdRisbAHV4Q.text: Excellent place to eat, awesome bacon, great service, clean and great food. Bryna was an excellent waitress, made us laugh, very responsive and when we return I will ask for her section.

ogG__jjDEwGq3yqYQZSYPA.text: I can't rave enough about this restaurant. Everyone is upbeat & friendly. Our server Nichole was the Best. Food came fast & Never had to ask for anything, like she Knew what we needed when we needed it. The Huge portions are 2nd to none at a very low price. A Must!

-6ut8t_LRo-CKvZLNeQUPw.text: Terrible service we came with a large group and they told us we had to wait 20 min we waited for almost an hour when my dad asked the manager about it she was very rude and was confronting my dad implying that it's our fault we had a big group when we had come a couple of days earlier and there was no problem the hostess had an RBF the whole time and she was very rude we waited and waited while like 50 people came in and they all got seated before us

dxLyut_sBbWeUriMzJfSiA.text: I have eaten at many Black Bear Diners and this is by far the best!  Great food and not full of grease. The service is superb too.

zcMONOQULGeYMCToFs52Zg.text: Arrived for breakfast on Fourth of July. I had been by this restaurant many times and this was my first experience eating here. The food was great, the service was excellent. Nichole was our waitress and she was very attentive to our needs, had great timing, was friendly and professional.   I would recommend Black Bear Diner to friends and family and plan to eat here again for dinner.

NrL95etOgmZHphDJ2vP6VA.text: My friend and I stopped in for lunch at this location on a recent Saturday. There was no wait and it was busy but not crowded. However, we were seated at the dreaded "no one's table" which is that table that none of the wait staff believe is their responsibility. Finally flagged down a waitress who agreed to take care of us. Only, she didn't. She placed our order, then ignored us, spending quite a bit of time chatting with a customer seated at another table, never once glancing up so I could get her attention. I finally flagged down another waitress as she zipped by, who very kindly said she would check for us and the food did then  finally appear. And, in my opinion, it was just OK but nothing special. I won't be going back.

kzRcuLyB5i53iIEqH3fexg.text: The very first place we went to in Vegas, even before registering into the hotel. I sat on the front bench to get acclimated to the surroundings, after all, I had driven all the way here from San Jose. My parents were next door to the Filipino restaurant with her childhood classmates. I was not about to join them, knowing they would be chatting about the good old days. It was either an El Salvadorean place that sold Pupusas or the Black Bear Diner. Since I've already been through my eating pupusas phase, I decided to eat here since I've never been to the one in my area (Milpitas). I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak because I've never had it before. I got a salad with ranch because Caesar dressing was not available. It was very good, but because I drove all the way from Northern California, I was still full from breakfast 2 hours earlier. I wish I would have finished it, but I ended up taking it to the hotel but didn't eat the rest because we didn't have a microwave oven in the room. It was a nice place with a very extensive menu and very attentive servers. At least I know there is one nearby if I ever decide to go there again.

HMkNhKBpm8nwwGjgfSwhOA.text: Right when I walked in the energy in that diner was OUTSTANDING. I was greeted by everybody! Including the cooks. Look I'm 23 and I could care less about writing reviews BUT I couldn't let this go, I had to write a review. I felt happy after I left. Also, Denise who is the one who personally helped me and she was amazing, greeted me with a smile and remembered my name. Pretty impressed. Definitely will return.

1VsnaFE7QRK7iPH6Qkekfg.text: We've been coming to these place but our last visit made me say, "I don't want to go back here anymore".   I used to love their pancake for its buttermilk flavor, but now I can't hardly taste it!  The last time we were there I ordered corned beef and the beef was so though, I can't hardly chew it.  The orange juice was horrible coz it was water down.  My husband didn't want me to complain but I told him, that's the last time we're going to have breakfast here.

k3cKBu1B2uo5XsUY3TwA2A.text: I have stopped in at this location a few different times after work on my way home. I have never been disappointed the food is great. Always hot and fresh. Service is always fantastic they truly go above and beyond to make sure you have that warm and welcoming experience and that have a wonderful visit. A must try place. Get the Chicken Fried Steak its delicious and take your self home some Banana Cream Pie you wont be disappointed.

7sawnZDUdWxcHRVDhi7o4g.text: We were a party of 10 on a Sunday afternoon and were seated in about 25 minutes just like Brenda said.  Sarah, our server was great and fast. She kept our drink glasses full and made sure to get us anything we needed.          John R.         Las Vegas

MrhO98U19WIQT9q7cyljCA.text: First time here because I heard a lot of good things about this restaurant and decided to give it a try. The food was just okay, I asked if they have turkey bacon or sausage but they didn't have any other substituon for people like me who cant have bacon or pork sausage for a religion reason. Then come the worst service from Barbara who from the beginning wasn't very attentive. Literally she was just there to take the order and drop the check. Hello, where is the service? She never came by to take away my empty plates, or refill my drink. Then when I asked for my water to be refill she brought a new one WITHOUT A STRAW but yet with her biggest attitude. At the end here she comes to drop the check after nowhere to be found. She had the gut to rush me and my husband by trying to take the plates away that still had food on it. And when we asked another server for a togo box for our food since our server nowhere to be found again, this server wasnt happy that we asked her maybe because she thought it wasnt her table. All in all these servers need to improve their customer service skill and maybe common sense. People come here to have a good meal and good service experience not to look at angry n mad faces from your servers. If you dont like your job stay home please these people dont deserve to experience your unhappiness.

CxSHgmyNoK0CwKxCXBXdOQ.text: great restaurant... decent prices.... good service... and lots of food for your dollar. love this place . atmosphere is great always playing oldies.

ip6TZOfS7pOQjdrfTyg9Zg.text: Love this place. It was the first for my family and boy we were not let down at all ,the sizes of the plates omg.

hReblvuhqKbzjN9XFGA0ag.text: Make sure you are hungry when you go to this place. The portions are huge. The diner and its decoration are welcoming. The customer service was amazing and the food was flavorful. I have never eaten eggs Benedict at Black Bear Diner before and I have to say that their California bacon with avocado was to die for. This was at the location in Las Vegas Blvd.

3ff5sotycghPKguFj4gOiQ.text: The best fried chicken I have ever had!!! I normally do not order fried chicken, because I always get disappointed. However, this time I just got curious and ordered it. Our sweet waiter claimed that she made it. Oh my, I was so glad she did! Four (or five?) pieces of crunchy and tasty fried chicks!!! My family envied me, because I enjoyed my meal so much. I am a sucker, so and I gave them just one to share. I did not even care for onion ring side dish, brought them home. I will come back for sure for more fried chickens!!! Good and clean family oriented restaurant. Reccomended!! Try the FRIED CHICKEN! Thank you!!

_CX6SV3W4_ECBviMrN9Uqw.text: I sat down at the counter ordered my breakfast and I'm waiting and waiting Look up at the board and see that the waiter didn't even put my order in. Every one that got there after me got their food THANKS FOR NOTHING

NZ6hJt0VihpqmmVA8CPM-w.text: I stopped in Vegas for the night on my way to CA. It was still early enough for a Thanksgiving meal for dinner. I drove around looking for a meal. Every place I stopped at was really really busy. I seen Black Bear and stopped in. I walked in and they seated me at the bar area where there was plenty of seating for one. I ordered the Turkey dinner and all the fixings. By the time I got my order, Black Bear really started getting busy. My dinner came and talk about hitting the spot! This was the best Thanksgiving Dinner I've ever had a restaurant . I really do recommend coming to B.B. for any meal. Keep up the good work and see ya soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Bear Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. x2 Shasta scramble! Fruit cup and a big pancake!

4BCyzPgRgEgXCHTMzcLp_w.text: Not sure what the hype is for this place! 1st we ordered our food (3 of us) ...they brought the side salads our first and blah. Just lettuce, shredded carrots, 2 cucumbers and 2 small tomatoes and the ranch dressing was gross. Had bacon bits in it and not good bacon. The fake crunchy bacon flavored crap.  Next, our meal was brought out for 2 of us. My husband asked where his was and the guy snickered like we were kidding? After 5 minutes my husband had to get up, find our server and ASK where his meal was. The Server said the kitchen burned his 1st order ( chicken and waffles) and would bring his order right out. Ummm... they could have told us that. So, he had to wait another 5 minutes. Meanwhile, his family is eating without him so our food won't get cold.  Next, our food was just bland. The mashed potatoes taste old and we're just barely warm. The Chicken fried steak was nothing special. It tastes like any frozen chicken fried steak you buy at Sams or Costco. The vegetable side was cut up zucchini and red peppers. Yuck and it was Barely cooked. I will say the macaroni and cheese was ok and the cornbread was good. Next time, I'll go to Cracker Barrel if I want home cooked food and not bland hospital type food

jnTXBGcbWbViqLv9zLOH9A.text: Did not dine at this Black Bear Diner.  My nephew was craving a waffle so dropped by here to get one to go.  That single waffle was expensive.  It looked good, but the taste was just okay.  Also got a Salted Caramel cookie for myself, and it tasted pretty darn good.  The restaurant itself looked terrific.  Clean and orderly.  Bakery case displayed the desserts very well.  Would not hesitate to dine in given the chance.

z56bsjfCCAlrL5oMXUq0oA.text: Breakfast was good. Large portions. Server (with server in training) was friendly, but had a nervous habit of tapping her pen while waiting for you to order. Whoever set up the table for four order off two forks and two knives. We usually visit this location when we come to Vegas.

fuewmGeVTgXrkddQBFRvUQ.text: Food was good but the service sucked. We went in for dinner, around 6:30. The waitress looked high and kept zoning out while we were placing the order.   We were there over an hour and she only refilled the water once. She never refilled the soda and I had to ask three times for the orange juice I requested to be brought out with the food.  We are adults and we're quiet and polite. When checking out a different waitress literally slapped the receipt on the counter and then threw the pen on the floor as we walked out. There was obviously some drama going on between the waitresses, but that doesn't give her the excuse to take it out on the guests.  I'm a local. I'm not coming back.

Y-SOu67CFoIn7SZo4g0Jyg.text: Sorry Yelp majority, but this place just isn't for me.   I will start on a positive note by saying that the employees were nice. Portions are large; even ordering off of the "little less" menu for those who have smaller appetites, I still had left overs. Prices are comparable to other breakfast joints around town.   Now to the not so good. Why is the music so dang loud? I could barely hear my friend from across the table. I'm all for playing music, but not nightclub loud. The tables are cramped together. With my pregnant belly and the other table behind me, I barely had enough room to scoot myself in. I took home my left over pancakes and had them the next day for breakfast. They were crumbly and falling apart as I took it out of the to-go container. I've never had pancakes from other breakfast places just crumble. And probably the nail in the coffin to this unpleasant visit was the soggy bacon. I can't stand when bacon is flimsy, almost to the point where I question if it's safe to eat or not.   Other people may love this place, but I'm just not a fan. Sorry not sorry.

A8SkewVfs2fjPdFFtcQvJg.text: We've always had great experience with BBD from where we came from. This was the first time we went at this location and we were thrilled that there was no wait on a Saturday morning. Didn't realize that the wait for a server to start our drink order will take at least 20 minutes! The restaurant was not busy at all and definitely had enough servers as they were standing around a laughing by the drink station. We left and we will never be back again.

ALfjlUUc1sVi8yvC6SlPmA.text: This is my first time at Black Bear Diner in Las Vegas & I was very Impressed. The service & breakfast was great! I would recommend this diner to everyone. My husband & I had a awesome experience. We will be back & excited that you have a location in Murrieta Ca near our home that we will be visiting.

NUZoiWiseu27dJ6zQOkz-w.text: Just had the best tri-tip dip sandwich ever, but that's not why I'm writing this review. Our server was so friendly, helpful and had manners. Amazing considering he was young. In fact, all the servers seemed friendly, you can tell they all pretty much liked one another & everyone was pitching in. Actually working. I was impressed!

n2OuBolbkGZLy04pp88ijw.text: Service was great, food was even better! After a long five hour flight and a car with no battery, we walked over to Black Bear Diner from our hotel. Wasn't packed when we went around 3pm. Menus were cute--made newspaper style. I ordered a patty melt with sweet potato fries and an Arnold Palmer. Food came super fast, was freshly done and still hot. They have more than one type of hot sauce, which is a winner in my book! They service breakfast, lunch and dinner all day.

vlzFqsd20MQDDB3WTKJjoA.text: If you're on the prowl for comfort food, this is your place. Black Bear Diner has a lot of hearty menu items that will leave everyone pleased and full. Their dessert is not any different. When you walk-in you get drawn to the behemoth sized dessert options next to the register. The desserts could be split by 2-3 people, that's how big these bad boys are. The newspaper menus make for great conversation starters and the atmosphere is always laid back.

fmNLyNZ_4Je4Qtjh9tbAIg.text: Decent breakfast spot. Big servings at a reasonable price. I love the theme of the restaurant and they also have different products that you can purchase. Went on a Friday morning after work with a coworker and was seated right away. Our waitress was friendly and fast to get our food and drinks. Checked on us often and since it was my first time there, explained to me what their restaurant was all about and offered recommendations. I ordered their Portuguese sausage and eggs (definitely not like Portuguese sausage from Hawaii, but it was still good) and I was pleasantly surprised that they gave me the whole stick of sausage haha. It also came with a slice of watermelon, hash browns, and pancakes. I didn't think I was gonna finish it, but I guess I was more hungry than usual that morning. And I was totally in a food coma on the way home. Lol. I love their baby bear hot sauce - tasted great with the food I ordered. They have 2 other sauces on each of their tables - mama bear and papa bear. I will try those next time I visit. I don't think there was anything that makes this restaurant really stand out compared to other places similar to it, but I had a good first experience so I'll be back.

The reason I didn't give a 5 is that the biscuits are dry and they don't give enough gravy.  The gravy was bland but I'm a southern girl and I expect lots of flavor from my biscuits and gravy. 1GcrgcY-b7Yd4xB2OTGVUA.text: We had Sarah take care of us and she did a wonderful job we appreciate you Sarah. The food is always great, lively bunch of fun employees. Never had a bad meal at Black Bear Diner. Thank you to all employees for making it a fun experience.

otmmRDSjkkH98-qh4xotBA.text: Our first time hearing of Black Bear during our west coast trip. So glad we chose to do breakfast here! The portions are huge, the food is delicious, the prices are very fair, and all the employees were extremely warm and accommodating!   The milkshake end led up being the size of two shakes, with all the extra they poured in an additional cup for us. The scramble entrees are huge and the pancakes are amazing - soft, moist, sweet cream pancakes!  Also, the menus are newspapers! Adorable. They refashioned some articles from a 1955 issue of the Las Vegas Sun, and sandwich the lengthy menu options with fun articles about bears and Vegas.

krGP8SzCjZEM3J9syuw7qw.text: This place is awesome  Delicious food  Great service  Amazing atmosphere  Good music  Great place for family and children

W5_3HQ-NuE4Tl1bbavEyMw.text: Nice place with awesome food and service. My cheeseburger was wonderful and my wife's tri tip sandwich was awesome. The price is right also

zuj75e70tS2IaqcLEhWdkg.text: I woke up one Saturday morning craving pancakes. My roommate who used to live in Arizona (and therefore no stranger to the Black Bear chain) remembered this place had just opened near the mall.  We got there around 11:30 a.m. and was quoted a 20 minute wait for two people. We waited on a bench outside for about 10 minutes before a couple large tables were seated and we could move to a bench inside. We were led to our table maybe five minutes after that.  Pros: The portions were ENORMOUS - I almost made the mistake of ordering three pancakes. Two of those plate-sized babies were more than enough, before the side of eggs, toast, and potatoes I ordered separately.  The food was delicious and hit the breakfast/brunch spot on the nose. No surprises, no exotic touches, just good old-fashioned diner food done right. The pancakes were fluffy, potatoes were crispy, and the eggs a perfect sunny-side up. I honestly can't think of a single complaint.  Cons: None. The food was fantastic, the service flawless, and the wait for brunch on a Saturday extremely manageable. I'll be back the next time (and every time) I have a craving for an unreasonably large stack of delicious, fluffy chocolate chip pancakes, or every other week!

JgFEv6KPcNVZUXbCLvLTvw.text: We've been here a few times food here is good , service on the other hand is a hit or miss being a server myself I deal with many people so yes your not always going to be happy but ... if you DONT  LIKE YOUR JOB then you should be in that industry customer service is a must .. just a little pointer put a SMILE ON for 2 seconds might get you a little further in your day

lQt7iQmBxq0jTJ0WDg7N1w.text: Visiting LV and was doing some shopping at the outlets. Getting late so I decided to just eat around here. This Black Bear Is newer than others I've been to... food was just as good. Pot roast excellent and potatoes and gravy were yummy. This was the small size. Excellent service.

The atmosphere is very cozy and I usually hate eating out but this place is 5 stars! 10 stars if I could give it that high of a rating!

CWFIQdIataPenePASGN0xw.text: Woo Hoo our first time here and brought Mom as she was visiting  and sure glad we did! Joanna our waitress was WONDERFUL! Although the restaurant was crazy busy, she was attentive and brought everything to our table quickly and exactly what we asked for  The food was served on huge platters and we were happy and full when we left.  Everything was amazing and tasted incredible.  My husband and I ordered the Chorizo Scramble and again it was the perfect meal.  There's so much on the menu we look forward to coming back and having Joanna be our waitress! Thank You Joanna, you're the best!

_gmmEYqff0bq-z4vGfhuIg.text: Such a cute little diner! Love the fact they serve all their menu all day, so for breakfast I had the chicken avocado club sandwich and fries! Huge portion, definitely a meal to split!   Sarah my waitress was super attentive, refilling my drinks and checking on me often. Very friendly even though she was super busy.   Nice little find for a work trip

LCHnyPgqEYjvOv5B8-cZ3Q.text: First time at a BBD and didn't realize this was the grand opening day. Fun and friendly environment. Large appealing portions. The service was attentive. Will return!

FV0TIi08qg1nBqvPQYL_Nw.text: Good food, large portions, great staff and fun atmosphere. Great diner - do yourself a favor and come here for any meal of the day.

ewJgI4oUpVOMGRAX4LZQMA.text: What a disappointment.  Things started out great. Got seated quickly. Menu looked great. Drink order taken promptly by host. And then.....NOTHING. Waiters and waitresses ignored us as they busily took other tables' orders or cleaned counters. Attempts to make eye contact didn't work. Friendly smiles and waves to wait staff didn't work. NO ONE wanted to take our order. Over 20 min waiting to place an order (on a not so busy morning),  so we paid for our cup of coffee and left. What a waste.

rbmPzHMibF8ycrgestRpsA.text: I had breakfast here with family on Saturday and the food was good, portions were generous, it was served hot and in a timely manner. We were seated promptly in the rear of the restaurant at a large round table. The waitress who appeared to be serving our area looked in our direction and walked into the kitchen. She came out of the kitchen and proceeded to stand and talk with other wait staff. we were not acknowledge us or come in our direction. As we continued to wait Shandi who was serving another area came to us and asked if we had been served. We said "No" she apologized for the oversight and immediately brought us beverages and took our order. She said she would expedite our order since we had been waiting. She could not have been more apologetic and pleasant. She talked with my grandson and was delightful to all of us.  She was not only serving but also busing tables when patrons left. She is an asset to your business. She turned an almost bad experience into a favorable one. I will come back next time I'm in LV. You need more people like her.

vkIAn66eIFYuLfc9W4rAog.text: Great to have another  Black Bear Diner so close by. Open now for about 2 weeks. Food is excellent, crew is wonderful. Shandi has waited on us twice now. Personality plus and very good service.

sx6v-rchnlPeAmL0exFPhg.text: My family and I went to this restaurant and the food was high-quality and delicious the portions were big but the food was Heaven they actually served real hand squeezed orange juice we ordered the Grizz the food was so much I could feed at least us and two more people In the end all in all this was the best restaurant I ever went I give it 5 stars

9hh21mg_5fKTrwbgE-EizQ.text: We arrived, were given water and waited 20 minutes before we gave up and left.  Will not be returning here.  Unfortunate.

4qLBBq6icM_TfBjjwOaz5A.text: Such a GREAT warm home style invirement! Our breakfast was perfect, the service is excellent! Sit at "Barbaras" station if shes working that day! ENJOY! We sure did and we'll be here everytime we come to Vegas!

g6jsFiIT_TZU6YdZYzpk6g.text: The food is good but they totally screwed up my order so bad twice they decided not to charge me. Waitress liked selling more than listening or executing even though I asked her twice for well done toast I got soggy cold bread. Asked her for ham and got bacon. Ended up eating cold eggs with no toast because it never came out. Expediter kept on asking for it. The expediter was excellent.

E8vyn2FG07E_16la2u3S-w.text: Been to couple other black bear diners have to say it meets the standard of other black bear diners

az6DFX98CbXshk3E03zf5w.text: This is a good diner. They are known for the chicken fried steak, but their turkey pesto sandwich with the kettle chips is my favorite.  This place is solid.

KLNowt2k_VE4gTC4WOPEMQ.text: This restaurant has a convenient location near the mall on South Las Vegas Blvd. All the employees are very nice. They offer the full menu all day long. I went for dinner and ordered the pot roast. It was delicious, so I came back a few days later to get a cheeseburger for lunch. I was expecting an amazing burger, but what came was a few notches below your typical one paddy In-N-Out burger. It was small and typical: nothing special. I did not think the fries were all that great either. A few days later I came for breakfast. I ordered bacon and eggs. It was excellent. In just three visits, I've seen the good and the bad. This place is known for big, American sized portions of food. It's mostly comfort food. If you're into that type of thing, you might like what they do there. However, if you're not a fan of big plate loads of food, you should try somewhere else. I give a thumbs up for breakfast and a so-so rating for lunch and dinner.

bhfOZIQcvdrstqDPl8Ktcw.text: Great play and great service.  I have never been disappointed at any Black Bear Diner.  We are here late for dessert only -can't resist the Huckleberry ice cream-only available here-a must stop for local and traveler alike.  I have eaten in quite a few Black Bear Diner's including the first and original location in Mt. Shasta.  I am always more than satisfied.  A not to be missed experience.  Stop into this location on South Las Vegas Blvd and say hi to Bobb, Brenda and Monique.  Prepare yourself for old fashioned hospitality and at home style cooking.

CTwF_VCC731VWjKhawhORw.text: First time having breakfast here. Would definitely recommend it! We had a party of nine and they got is in no problem. Very reasonable prices and some of the best biscuits I have had in a very long time. I would drive past 5 cracker barrels to eat here! Service was excellent and the coffee was great too. Gonna have to try lunch here next...

ZEbZJHSqMxzlSqdTLvNtfA.text: The customer service was top notch. Our waitress Barbara was on top of everything and very very sweet. The meals were large portions and good pricing. It was our first visit here and we will definitely return again soon.

RK-oYXGB_6kE3kB6X5996A.text: My husband and I went here for breakfast for the first time today. The food was absolutely delicious. The service was stellar. The biscuits were amazing. We will definitely be back!

HBDAeVQcBc_215NfCEOD0w.text: Wow! The portions are crazy! The pancakes were perfection (and the size of a small pizza), bacon cooked to perfection and eggs (I swear they gave me 6 eggs). Either way, we loved it!

Svp3ZtHqYLbbT8Waks_d2g.text: I have been to the other ones in Las Vegas and this was my second trip to this one. At 6 am we were one of three tables ...My coffee mug was dirty....there was no spoon to stir my coffee.. there was dust on the window sill...The waitress was busy with paper work while I waited for a clean coffee mug. .. The food was barely warm... .. for a breakfast place they need to do a better job of blocking the direct sunlight in the early morning....no matter where you sit the sun is in your eyes.... I doubt that I will be going back to this location....It is a shame because it is about 3 miles from my house.... Sorry

JiMxkDNBiivciCy7i-nVgw.text: Decided to hit Black Bear before we left Las Vegas. I had the Hobo Omelette. Good breakfast without being too much food. Another good visit. Friendly staff and good food. I look forward to trying another one on a different trip.

-qrSXRoFOJWWqvraj4e4Bw.text: Been there 5 times - twice for breakfast and 3 times for an early dinner.  Breakfast is packed but we have never waited and the food is great!  We have had the same server at night and she is amazing! I give a shout out to Toniann!  She makes our decision so easy on what to order and what options we have when ordering our dinner.  Went there last night and she was working, again. I am so impressed with her personality and the way she treats us.   Felt that I needed to take the time to compliment her and as they say "give her the time of my day" and recommend the restaurant and her.

5JvxIWammYyyM_qO8Rip0Q.text: Food is good and service was great.  Not a good choice for handicap access though. We have eaten at the other two Black Bear Diners and wanted to try this new location since it is closest to home.  I did not see any handicap parking close to the entrance.  Similarly, there was no handicap access ramp near the entrance (I did not see one at all).  Since I use a walker, just getting from the parking lot to the hostess station was an effort.  The other locations have much better access if you have a disability.

YCssuX8tIpwvoihCjTjIOA.text: New location near the outlets - food was excellent, staff friendly and efficient and the place is spotlessly clean! We sat at the counter and the server Enat was great.  It was quick but not rushed.. very happy to have this new location near my house.:) Will be back and definitely recommend.

w2ODzP1Vn6yPB2yxgozx_Q.text: We love Black Bear but won't go back to the Las Vegas Blvd location. Ordered our regular "corned beef w/potatoes plate". CB came to us in crumbles! When we brought it to server's attention, she said she'd never seen it made like that before. She brought manager to table who insisted that's the only way BB makes it. Told her that we had it "regular way" many times @ other BB locations. She ended up bringing another plate cooked more like what we were used to. Why would we make up what we had before?! And why would we order it again there if we didn't like the way it was prepared @ other locations?! We also order a "coconut custard" pie to bring home as the server assured us it really was delicious coconut-custard - only to be sorely disappointed! It was like no other coconut custard pie we'd ever had. After one piece, it went in the garbage! So disappointed!

6rlsUG7xCmcGPnoNerWg3w.text: What happened to this place?  Tried it a year ago when in Vegas and really liked it...really good food...really good service.  My experience today was quite the opposite.  I not only overheard my waitress bickering with her manager but she also made a snotty comment about me because I asked a second time to have the mess of food and debris under my table cleaned up.  I got an omelette and hash browns.  The hash browns were look warm at best and the omelet was just not good.  They were also out of orange juice.  I will not be coming back here again.

f-ihOSYj5Z8vqlLImmbr5Q.text: Great food, great service, great place. Their pancakes are fluffy and tasty. Had their huevos rancheros and they were delicious. Tasty coffee, too.

DtP3FzODyQPLG6uW9Nra-A.text: I came into the Las Vegas Blvd location this morning for breakfast. This is my 3rd time dining here. Shandi Lynn was my waitress and she has such an awesome personality....

4KOb_JIcUY9RZvxYbxErZg.text: This was my first time here.  My friends highly recommended this location. Our waitress SHANDI danced with us at our table. She was most  informative and gracious. The menu was no problem after her expert navigation. She made our breakfast experience memorable. We shall return. Thank you SHANDI-LAND

9siDkCqN7f7XTev5o5l03Q.text: We ate at Black Bear Diner today. The food was perfect!! Eggs were fluffy and bacon was cooked to crispy perfection. We were served by Shandi and she made us feel at home. She is a great waitress. I highly recommend this restsurant!

84y5qHHef9T8L8mCcfdOMQ.text: Ate here recently.  One of the best places in town for breakfast.  Large portions for a good price.  Our 2 year old always enjoys eating here.  Servers are always super friendly.

c7xsAFdSd5lj_D9sEa3YnA.text: My family that came from Ecuador and I came here for the first time and we LOVED it! The food is delicious and the service is awesome. Friendly staff! They also play amazing music. We will definitely be coming back! Recommend this diner to anyone you will leave with a happy face and a full stomach!

VCFPMJeGpeW5JWKt2joxCA.text: We've been to a few Black Bear diners so visiting this one in Las Vegas was already a familiar setting. I believe it was very newly built so it doesn't have the same fun bear charm that some of the others have. There were four of us in for breakfast and we all decided to have the Huevos Ranchos. We also got a huge bear claw for something extra. Coffee all around completed our breakfast. The Rancheros was really very good and we all enjoyed it. It came with fresh fruit and country potatoes that really made the dish. The bear claw was a disappointment because they murdered it in the microwave! Really pissed me off because it turned hard within minutes and was extremely hot. Service wasn't bad but could have been much better.

XSvpzH8Luvxc5RnpbdJbMg.text: Great service and wonderful food. The waffle was so dreamy. I got a scramble with pickled jalepeno and tortilla strips. So good.

ODlJk1E1xk3asB3g4ROhZA.text: Rod the general manager is top notch!!  My husband and I sat at the counter and got to watch Rod in motion. He motivates he crew and keeps the food moving well keeping his work area in top notch clean and well supplied for his servers. I was so impressed. We had small problem with our food not even time to thinking about it he took my husband food and replaced. Our server Enete you are also awesome thank you for great first time visit to this location. Laura and Ray thank you!

UTKur0aADkVEV6Zv0Khvrw.text: We mossed on in just before closing. We weren't all that sure that we'd be received well or that we'd good service. We were wrong.  The server was a sweetheart. She made sure that we got everything that we needed and brought out some things to us that were mistakes that she was in the process of "fixing". The few folks dining here when we arrived definitely noticed my daughter. She waved at all of them and they waved back.  She walked to a few folks to give high fives, hugs, and kisses.  The patrons are all so nice. Some of them chatted with me and my husband.  Our food came and it was on!  We jumped into our food and I doubt we came up for air til it was all gone. Everything was delicious. We were super duper extra hangry, but we've been here a few times to know that their food has been consistently tasty and fresh. The value is great for our little family of 3. I wanted to get a bear claw but we didn't have any way to store it and we were just too full.  The restrooms are well maintained here, yay!  The cashier is friendly and is on topi of it.   Everyone seems to do their part and pick up for others where they can. I guess you could say that this is like any other diner but for us, it's our first choice. Be sure to take a photo with the bears outside. With each location that we have been to, we take a photo with the bears and my daughter. Fun. I know this also sounds nutty but joining their email club, you can get some pretty good coupons in there.

If-4oPp3aJidzfH4pynP6A.text: Deceptive food... This place is going down. I was served a PROCESSED ham, cheap processed crap at the price of the real one. In brief, my husband and I came to this place for breakfast, in particular, for the ham that I always liked in there; ordered a couple of portions. While having  my breakfast, I found out that the ham I had been brought was processed, not real, as I expected (you can usually distinguish it by texture and flavor), whereas my husband was brought a good piece of real ham. It's so disappointing, not my fav place anymore!

FCo3w1kVXYaYzN8tc4FIOg.text: Great service , pancakes were fabulous ( i had bacon cakes). HUGE portions so bring your appetite. Others in the party had chicken and waffles ( was much better than the picture) and the chicken sausage ( which I ended  up eating quite a bit of).  Will absolutely return when back on the west coast.

Only complaint would be there sometimes run out of items. Prices are cheap too. Meal desert and drink will run you $15 or so. Staff always helpful!

q4sQMjnW48MI6XRw-mvnHA.text: We LOVE Black Bear Diner!!! The food is great. We especially love the Chicken Pot Pie and the Chicken & Waffles. And the pies are sooo good. It is a good value and the service is always good.  I'm only taking a star because on 3 out of 6 visits, we were given dirty silverware. It's pretty unappetizing to pick up your unused fork and see somebody else's dinner still stuck to it.

ceCo_BcZzLZ_7OH60NbLPg.text: Decided to try this place out based on the recommendation of a friend. Loved it! The service was wonderful and attentive to everything. My wife had the croissant sandwich and I had the scrambowl. Both were heavenly. The pancakes are made with buttermilk and sweet cream, giving them a nice sweet taste that needed no syrup. Totally coming back the next time we are in Vegas. Will probably be trying the one in Barstow, actually.

EpvRhTIDjBOAOv1ANVGaxQ.text: I'm giving this restaurant 3 stars for the food. It's always delicious at any black bear diner. The rest is below their chain standards. We went there Sunday for breakfast and they were busy but from the time we walked in and put our name on the wait list it was down hill from there. Other people that came in after us were getting seated first, not just us there was another couple next to us had been waiting also. We finally get seated and the music wasn't their normal oldies music instead it was some loud hip hop music. We were seated right across from the jukebox it was so loud we asked to be moved. That music made me feel very irritable. We asked about the music and the waitress said that a customer had put money in to play music but I don't so. It was like a whole cd worth of music. I felt like getting up and leaving. The wait staff seemed to enjoy it, some were singing some lyrics and another person standing near the entrance to the kitchen was moving to the beat. This makes me think somebody brought in their own cd. I was glad when it was finally done and it went back to its normal jukebox tunes. The service is usually great but they were very busy and no one ever stopped to see if we needed any refills or to see if everything was alright. But they were very busy. After our meal we left to pay, there again another problem! No one to take our money. There were other people standing in line to pay and no one to take our money. We finally just left our money along with the bill and walked away. I'm sure we probably could have just walked out and no one would have known. Either they need better management or hire or schedule more people on Sunday. I've been to other black bear diners with much better service, and great wait staff and great atmosphere. Somebody needs to step it up a bit at this Las Vegas location, seriously.

HL2qve_6tP38oYy8DU4U4Q.text: My first time to dine in this restaurant. It's a very busy restaurant. I got seated at the counter right away. The server assigned (Enat) talks to fast and sound likes she mumbling too. I could hardly understand what she was saying. I felt like I was rushed to make quick decision on what to order. I know they are so busy and working under pressure but that's not an excuse to not treating the paying customer properly. The food is not bad. I'm not sure If I will be revisiting this restaurant any time soon. One thing I loved about living in this city (Las Vegas) is the enormous number  of restaurants here. One restaurant taken off from my list is not a big loss.

U3_Vdclb_JPnFeaDVlCe3g.text: I love BBD! As a cali native I've been to several, as we were leaving Las Vegas we wanted a good breakfast before heading back home. This BBD sucks ! The Service was lacking, but that necessarily wasn't the deal breaker, the food itself was. I always get the prime rib scramble, it had no flavor. The toast was super burnt, the steak was all fat and chewy, will not return to this location.

LGVnMJLtbJV1LU32_8X0Og.text: Just found out that this place exists in Vegas! Love the breakfast menu! I had breakfast links and my husband had the hobo omelet.  Filled us up until dinner.

jbru0eWEVN7YFIVEU8T0zQ.text: Not a bad restaurant at all. I rated average cause everything about it was average.  I do give some credit to to the waitress who helped us. It was a busy Thursday night with two big parties. We waited a little longer than what we expected just to get our order in but we knew why and she kept coming back to us and letting us know she didn't forget about us. Bless her heart so no problem with her.. she was awesome. The food was ok. The portion size was great but the taste was average. It wasn't bad but in my opinion I've had better breakfast. The sweet tea is awesome tho! I love sweet tea and I would say their sweet tea compares to Caines sweet tea.

61CYVcjR7xU6DFpRR4Z-vw.text: If you live delicious home cooked food made with love and care, this is the place. The pot roast was to die for. Best I've ever had. Service is five star to match the food. Nothing but high fives over here. Gonhere.

T4Nr3L0zfqWaBeYb6nGtbg.text: To go experience:  Ordered some breakfast to go as my family was heading home from vegas.  The food itself was great, the california omelette was delicious, coupled with the fruit and cottage cheese it was a good breakfast.  Restrooms are average, could be re-done, but are clean.  The person who took my order was a little bit rude, and appeared to not want to be at her job.  She also had attitude when asked for the passport code.  Satisfied with the food but not the service itself.

VXA_mxFSMiJRQI8owno1FA.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE...always amazing, always consistent, and always so friendly...never had a bad meal and I love going here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner...this time I had the Chicken Taco Salad (for the second time)...it's HUGE...yet so light and fresh...if you love salad it's a must order...also tried the Strawberry Shortcake for the first time and although they didn't have the special cinnamon biscuits they made it with the traditional one and it was TO DIE FOR...of course they went overboard because they felt bad they didn't have the ones they were supposed to so that was even extra special...if you want some delicious damn good food...check out Black Bear Diner...and ask for Bob...he's the Man!

Photo of Black Bear Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Taco Salad

dNbumJ0hsdGOK1B4bM3PZQ.text: My first visit on a Sunday morning (8:30 AM) and I'm a fan...  BB Service:  Our server was pleasant throughout our breakfast and the kitchen got our 3 orders to the table quickly.  The morning rush crowd wasn't in yet so it was nice and quiet.  Other servers not assigned to our table would stop by and ask if I wanted more coffee frequently.  Great stuff there.  BB food:  My California omelet was tasty and all the ingredients were fresh.  Wheat bread was toasted perfectly and the portions were in line with the price point of all our dishes.  The steak and eggs special was a win and the pancakes are larger than usual.  Overall everything I sampled from my friend's breakfast dishes were flavorful.    BB Ambiance:  A jukebox powered by the patrons keeps music in the background.  There's plenty of booths, seating and a counter for this very popular diner.  The theme has this log cabin, forestry feel with plenty of wood utilized for the seating and decor.  In summary, this is a great Diner that serves tasteful comfort food dishes.  At about 9:30 AM, there was huge breakfast rush and the whole waiting area was at full capacity quickly.  Something to consider when you feel like stopping by, but Black Bear Diner is popular because they deliver.  Enjoy!

9vM8yV0W_wbf5Ph_SbdbIg.text: First restaurant I stopped at when I came to Vegas. Not far from the airport and a nice food selection. I really loved that the menus are on newspapers. Loved the bear decor throughout the diner. They offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner items which were all available to order.   Shantel was my waitress and she was very sweet and friendly. She gave good food advice and made nice small talk with our table.  I ordered the bacon cheddar burger with a fried egg added on and a side of sweet potato fries.  Food was delicious and didn't take to long to arrive. Burger has nice flavor and was pretty big. I love sweet potato fries and these were good as well.   I definitely would go back, I want to try the chicken and waffles or the French toast.

wu-iRWCNmy9mVuplkyPDew.text: Some of the best country fried steak around. Attentive service and large portions.  Very reasonably priced, considering.

MVah9nVk1fMxQzMnqKKKYw.text: Great breakfast spot.  The menu is pretty extensive so definitely had a hard time deciding what to try but went with Bears Choice which is your basic two eggs, pancake and choice of meat combo.  But basic also meant lots of food!   Pancakes were a generous size and were fluffy and tasted delicious even without syrup.  Loved how they cooked the bacon, crispy yet not burnt.   Had a bite of Thank you country fried steak and that was good and would definitely go back and order that.   Restaurant was very busy but they friendly and attentive.   They had a juke box which played great music throughout our meal.  Great touch!

Oo3hX-pH73-Qh7TcUgfKnw.text: Great quick bite to eat. Service was fair, generous plates that have great flavor, you can tell each dish was made to order, and the orange juice was delicious.

Jk7st1ktY-P-0ZwaEcZ4VQ.text: This place is always packed and has a line on the weekends but it is totally worth it.  If you have a small group of say 2 or less it definitely pays to stick your head in and look to see if you can find open seating at the front bar. The service is much quicker at the bar then it is at the table and this will shave 30 minutes off your time at the restaurant easily.   I really like the country fried steak and gravy it comes with hashbrowns a couple eggs and I opted for 1 pancake instead of a biscuit. The pancakes are huge and absolutely delicious here!   Load up your hash browns with some of the papa bear hot sauce. It is so addictive. I am definitely going to purchase some bottles of it next time I'm in this joint!

5uON34tQ40aCC497XtpcCg.text: So being an east coaster, I was blessed to have many diners in PA.  I have been in Las Vegas for over 5 years and could not find a good diner for breakfast.  So Christmas Eve the girlfriend said I need to take you to breakfast. she wanted me to meet at this place.  I walked into being greeted and seated with in a few seconds of walking in.  I ordered steak and eggs deal, and all the food came out piping hot, and good.  This review would not be complete if I did not talk about the fabulous service from the staff. As the review is a little delayed I do not remember the servers name, but with my observation all the staff was treating everyone great.   I will be heading and will be updating this review

SgU2yTn5ufju7roLjRZ0Rw.text: Went on a surpise adventure when a family friend invited me out here! They serve Breakfast Lunch n Dinner and boy, I had the Loaded Mac n Cheese w Garlic Bread and some fries, and the others had some cuts of steak. All the food was delicious- ate every last bit. Great portions! Worth the prices. Our server was a lovely gal named Mirella- super sweet, checked on us often, and gave absolute 5 Star Service  Keep up the great work! Whenever Im back in Vegas Ill be bringing others along, definitely!

vUdl3YiO7_lBk52HOuTJCg.text: We don't have a Black Bear Diner where I live, so whenever we get a chance to visit, we do.   I like to get the french toast. It's really good! The hash browns are also really good. It's hard to impress me with a good hash brown, but these ones are on the list as a must-have.   We've been to this location twice, and it gets crowded with the breakfast crowd on the weekends. Food is fresh and served nice and hot.   Also, the waitstaff is friendly. When you're finished, you go back up front to pay at the register.

xfYlefhqSGPgx4oXH04nFA.text: I've never had anything close to a bad experience at Black Bear Diner!  The employees are incredibly friendly and helpful. The entire restaurant is always spotless. The prices are very average and reasonable. And to top it all off, the food itself is amazing. They have so many options on their menu to meet anything you desire, and it's always fresh and super tasty.

The service that my family and I received was great all thanks to our server Abel. He was very patient and took all our orders. He took the initiative and offered to make my mom's meal gluten free because she is allergic to wheat.  Each meal had a side which made us full.  Therefore, come with an empty stomach or you will be leaving with boxes.

uYwJnaoTX46XFDn354C41w.text: What a great place off the strip. We were heading out to the Grand Canyon and wanted to hit up something quick with a nice breakfast. Found this gem few miles away from strip and right off the highway.   We were greeted and seated very quickly. The staff were very chippy and nice to not only us but literally everyone walking in. The menu is created and shaped like a newspaper - Genius!  The portions are huge here, you could share dishes or be selfish and have your own!  We ordered Fit & Focus Chicken and Apple Sausage Scramble - came out fresh and hot! Very healthy option to pick and it tasted very good.  We also ordered the Ham & Cheese Omelette - It came out hot and fresh and cheesy!   Didn't care for the hash browns. It was not crunchy and too soft for my liking.  The best part of all of this is that damn BACON!!! Get it on the side, it compliments with your meal or by its dang self. Very thick, smokey, and just amazingly delicious.

The portions are extremely small, the fries and fish were greasy and appear to look like and taste like the crap you get in the freezer section of the market.  The club sandwich was small and sad.  Not impressed.  The cole slaw was a half of the tiny container and dry.  The only thing good was my cut up fruit.  But how can you mess that up.  We ordered take out.  The cook was a Hispanic guy who didn't speak English.  Maybe that's where the problem is.  Maybe they need a better cook.  We wasted $40.00 tonight and we will never go back and will tell others to avoid this place.  Do yourself a favor and go any place but here.  It was truly disappointing and horrible.  We threw away most of the food.  It's busy here, so they must be getting the tourists who are used to eating subpar food.  As a local, I'm avoiding this place. xu7yLa4JHtBy5iE15iAFDw.text: Went in this morning and couldn't be more disappointed. Took a minute to be seated which wasn't a problem. We ordered the bacon and egg breakfast with bacon crispy, and a Denver omelet plus 2 coffees. It took awhile for the food to come out, in the mean time we had both finished our coffee and no one had come by to refill. (Mind you the restaurant is NOT busy and at the most 1/4 full ) the food finally comes out and the manager basically dropped and ran, but we were able to ask for more coffee... I didn't have a chance to tell anyone that the bacon was NOT crispy. After waiting a minute and no one, and I mean no one who works there was in the dining room, I just decided to eat it. Waiting, waiting, waiting.... no coffee. I finally had to get up with both cups and walk to the front of the restaurant to ask for more coffee. I was given the reason as they got slammed. I know what slammed is, and this was no where close to being slammed. In fact most of the employees were keeping themselves busy doing a whole lot of nothing. Finally got more coffee!  At no time did anyone come by to see if we needed anything or if everything was ok. Because by this time it was realized that the omelet was over cooked and there was so much ham and nothing else on it that it was to the point of inedible.  While the manager apologized when we were leaving and I expressed my disappointment. He is a bit abrupt. When he asked if everything was good, I said no and his response was "why" not oh no what can I do, but Why! We will not be returning to this location. There are other locations in town that have far superior service

sDFQDbGgQQz561HdKH4aiQ.text: Very mediocre burger and chicken pot pie looked good but but tasted nothing special. The staff was attentive and the place is nice but the overall food quality and tastes don't let me to give this place more than 3 stars.

4SBnLryO2TKuxK0Jd_58aQ.text: I can't give this place enough stars! It was wonderful and we ate here both mornings we were in the LV area. Their omelets are delish and come with plenty of food! Must get the hashbrowns, so flavorful. I got the cinnamon roll french toast one morning and it was so worth all the calories! Highly recommend coming here. I wish there was on in FL!

4a9NPmanfHCvdDasbFwCUQ.text: Stumbled upon this diner on Yelp as my family and I drove in from California to visit Las Vegas. We arrived just around 9AM on 12/26/17 only to find that it was slightly starting to get busy. We got a seat at the bar and was helped right away.   This place was definitely a traditional diner with mom and pop style food ... meaning portions were HUGE. The menu was creatively printed on newspaper, paper and folded like newspaper. Very cute!  I got the breakfast special which was steak and eggs that day. It also comes with potatoes and toast. I ordered my son the chocolate chip pancakes with a side of hash browns. My husband ordered one of the breakfast plates with a side of pancakes. His breakfast plate came with eggs, bacon, sausage and a biscuit.   Now let me tell you... these pancakes were the size of my head. They were huge! Delicious too! Everything tasted wonderfully! The steak was seasoned and cooked perfectly, eggs were delicious and the potatoes were more like a hash and it was probably my favorite to eat. My husband raved about his sausages - said they were the best sausage patties he had ever tasted!   Overall, we had a great experience. After we placed our order, service seemed to slow and it took longer than expected to get our food but that did not stop us from enjoying our time at Black Bear. If we are ever on the west coast, we will surely find a location to stop in!   ***Update: Just found out that Black Bear is coming to Katy, TEXAS! As native Houstonians, we will surely take the drive up to dine!

VWDwqIyDArPTpn6hxNbMfw.text: Generally I always enjoy their food and Sunday night was no different. We stopped in for a quick meal before our nighttime departure flight. I had breakfast and my wife enjoyed a dinner item. Service was very friendly and very good. Only issue was the bathroom cleanliness was lacking and required attention. You don't like to see that in a restaurant. It gets you wondering about the condition of the kitchen! Time to tidy up!

OU1WtwJ3TGTCxRCGpK0lfQ.text: First timers and well worth it. They have breakfast, Lunch, Dinner day or night. We wanted breakfast but decided on dinner. Amazing Tri-Tip Platter and Ribeye Steak plates. Comes with soup or salad and I had to try their Tortilla Chicken Soup. Very yummy.  Their Mash Potatoes OH MY WORLD. So creamy and yummy.  But I must say when you first walk in they tell you their plates are huge unless you get the little bites. True to their word and yes it's like going back to your grandmother home cooking. A must try if you haven't. Recommendations.... hard to say as it all looks good enough to eat

ndQzYDcn6Sq4V-8ZqdyN-g.text: This place is okay. I've never really been a fan of black bear diner but my parents like it so we go here sometimes. When we first got here I was super happy to see they have a veggie burger! When I ordered I asked for it on no brioche bun and instead asked for a stirato bun and I also asked for no red onion, mayo, or thousand island dressing. Unfortunately, they served the burger on a brioche bun and it had red onion. They did make it without mayo or thousand island dressing. So I just ended up eating the patty only which was prepared very well! I think the problem was more with the server. She wasn't very attentive and personable and probably missed what I said about not having the brioche bun or red onion. This is just a guess though and I'm not sure where things went wrong, if it was the server or the cook. I understand why it happened since I know normally they make it on a brioche bun and with red onion. Still, it was a little disappointing. The music is also very loud and just overall things seem to be a little unorganized. I got a baked potato and it was HUGE and was good! Next time I think I'll just get a salad though...

x0nzxqhZyIx3uPS2fg6etg.text: ** DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE!!!  I just ordered breakfast for delivery at my hotel room.  I ordered an egg scramble which came with an English Muffin and coffee.  When I received my order, there was NO sugar/sweetener and no cream for my coffee.  There was no butter, honey or jam for my English Muffin.  The scramble was good, but the "hash browns" were so soggy, it was like they were uncooked. dHCC4LD5MV6cPYovgGlj9w.text: This place was pretty good. We went to one in California last month and I liked it, so when a friend from out of town came in we decided to give the local one in Las Vegas a try. Luckily we went on a Sunday when it wasn't too crazy busy yet, you know how people love the Sunday breakfast! The service was good, and the food came out pretty fast.  I ordered the corned beef hash with my eggs over medium (which most places get it wrong and I have to send it back) and the eggs were done right, yay! The corned beef part of it was very chunky, a little dry for my taste though. If you're looking for a good diner with huge portions of comfort food, Black Bear Diner is a good recommendation. My out of town friends thought it was tasty, and the portions were so big that we all had leftovers to take home. That's always a good thing so you can enjoy your meal twice.

8c-hva0GhUziGiu6Dz6CwQ.text: We were a four top and ordered pot roast (little dry), meatloaf, chicken fried steak (thumbs up) and chicken pot pie  (a little salty).   Huge portions. PS77wcz8FZDYSc9XJuDNQw.text: The bomb! Denver omelet is the best and servers are Awesome! I have never had anything bad here.  Puts Egg Works to shame and if you don't believe me, go find out for yourself!

TBjeAwNan6E-0hLN8oYToQ.text: I have past this location many times as I make my way to the El Salvadoran restaurant a few doors down. This restaurant seems packed all the time with people waiting outside. This morning my husband wanted to go out for brunch. As we were planning out our day, we figured we'd try Black Bear based on where we were going to run errands for the day.   As we expected, it was busy. But because of the size of the restaurant, wait time was only 20-minutes. The host was very nice and helpful. But two seats opened up at the counter sooner so we decided to take those seats and I wish we didn't.   We love the lodge-like atmosphere. We think the woodsy looking chairs are cute, the branding of black bears throughout the restaurant. My husband thought it was so cute they had their own  ketchup.   We also thought the food was good. My husband had the very large Big Bear breakfast that came with chicken fried steak, choice of red potatoes and pancakes. I decided on the small club sandwich which I was glad I did. Much more manageable to eat and I was able to finish it all. I chose onion rings over French fries.   Update Review 2/8/2019 Although I still stand behind that I felt that the service I received was far less than what I had expected, I wanted to update my review from my original post from 2/2/2019  It is apparent that someone from the restaurant read my review, talked to the server and the patron sitting next to me messaged me about my experience.  The conversation was cordial.  Turns out the couple sitting next to me are regulars and have befriended many of the staff members at the restaurant.  Thinking back, I believe this as I do recall upon leaving the counter that another server started to strike up a conversation with an elderly couple that had just sat down and had remembered their usual, "you want me to get .... started for you?"  For the regulars of this location, they've become part of the Black Bear family.  This I can respect.  Although I don't expect to ever make this a regular dining spot as this is not the type of comfort I grew up on, and although feeling like part of the family wasn't my experience, I'm more than happy to up this review to 4-stars on-behalf of all those that have had the 5-star experience.  Hopefully next time, I'll get to experience it for myself.  Review from 2/2/2019 So why the 2-star review? The server at the counter . Throughout the entire meal, she stood there and talked with her friends that happen to be patrons sitting next to us at the counter. It's just a habit for me that I don't interrupt people having a conversation. So for me to interrupt her while she should be working wasn't easy for me to do. And I thought, don't you think you should let your friends eat in peace while you WORK! She knew I was irritated with her. When it came time to take our order after waiting a long while, she all of a sudden became a fast and soft talker. WHAT DID YOU SAY MY OPTIONS ARE!? Oh! French fries, onions rings or sweet potato fries.  Geez!    Earlier when we first sat down, it seemed that one of the other severs was her husband as he told the couple next to us that they were going to their house tomorrow for super bowl and that they have babysitters for the kids. So all the talking you were doing, could've been down tomorrow?  Later, a woman sat on the other side of the couple. Guess who took her order? The counter server's husband. Who filled our water? The husband. And no, they are not the restaurant owners or managers as the couple wore the usual black t-shirt uniform while the manager wore a blue collared shirt.   This really should be at least a 4-star review but thanks to the lackluster counter server, this visit gets 2-stars.

lyQFgZVfx7XQdMl6muYlZQ.text: Looking for a breakfast location off the strip and jumped on Yelp. Thanks to fellow Yelpers, this restaurant surfaced to the top with great reviews and it was very close.    The location has very interesting decor and the menu has many options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I missed the dessert case at the front and saw it on the way out. Looked awesome!    Enjoyed my breakfast and the service was great.  It was a little busy at 9am, but didn't take long to get waited on.    I ordered the avocado toast with two eggs on the side.  It came with fruit and sliced tomatoes.   I did also have the fresh squeezed orange juice from their machine onsite. Really good.    I would recommend and will return in the future.  Make sure you check them out if you are in the area.

vNf7gACI8OYwF8aKRy-I-A.text: Service was great. Not sure where the review came about the loud music but the music was not loud at all. The food was actually really good. I got the meat loaf with mash potatoes. I can stay those was REAL potato's. If they was instant they did a great job at tricking me. The meatloaf was very good. After lot of traveling I have been doing and eating a lot of fast food everyday and every night it was very rewarding to eat some good comfort food. I will definitely be back.

pKeZpMdKMRfc6oZkdI0I7w.text: Hands down the best diner in the USA.   Portions are huge. Senior citizens should plan on sharing these huge breakfast platters. My order was the basic two eggs , sausage patty, red potato home fries. Here is where the meal gets better. The counter has a foot riser the likes I've never experienced before. It helped relax my back so the meal could be enjoyed. Great flavor, love the cumin in the sausage (Italian style) eggs were perfect over medium. Served in less than ten minutes! Black bear has a great order control system so I expect other diners to be challenged keeping up with this customer service challenge!!!  Highly recommended for breakfast!  No, I could not finish my plate. Awesome awesome awesome!!!

mHKHlkNN5X13W38WOH9kkQ.text: We needed a lunch spot after flying into Vegas and that spot looked nice. I usually don't leave a review unless I really like the place, and this spot didn't disappoint. Definitely seems family friendly and had a fun theme throughout. The food was awesome and I was stuffed when I left. Highly recommend the Machaca Breakfast tacos. I would definitely go back.

aeTXWAkuD_TWTt_4MQ-hBg.text: They don't have gluten free options which was a bummer. But I found a good salad and my friend had an amazing omelet. The food was good and the service was amazing! EDQvdt4B1k5EflVv_WKS1A.text: First place I have been in where the cleaning crew swept and mopped the floor while you were eating. Rather ruined the taste.. disinfectant  and pancakes just don't mix. The dining room maybe ok but eating at the counter..awful.

v7pRYS97eN95XoNinFk_IQ.text: Busy morning as usual.  Waited 10min for booth. Ordered 2egg breakie. Asked for crispy bacon and hash.  Waited 22 min for order, came w/ limpy bacon, soggy hash. Sent back, waited addl 10min. Food came back with cold eggs, same hash, and crispy bacon. 1 out of 3 ain't bad right????  Mgr comp'd meal, with a smile.   I was not smiling.

7_5ICBGGDdlEQoad4Im6Rg.text: First time here and i have to say this place is busy (Las Vegas Blvd. Location). My mom and me decided on lunch items. A ruben on rye and a chicken avocado bacon club. Not too bad the ruben was a bit salty/sour but serving portion is large here. My chicken avocado club was tasty and also very big in portion. I would definitely recommend this place to try. I can't wait to come back and try their breakfast items. Everyone around us that ordered breakfast food looked amazing. And they have a very large selection from breakfast to dinner dishes. Oh and the desserts looked amazing as well but unfortunately we left no room on this trip to try... For sure next time.

S8IvYPDgyAze9UqI4UuchA.text: Lots of great food at very good prices!  You won't regret eating here.  Had the Turkey plate on Thanksgiving. Came with potatoes, stuffing, broccoli, carrots, and cranberry.

eY_spiQDBAnU0z2scHu1gg.text: Love Black Bear diner! Big portions of rib sticking food.   This particular location has some service issues with their older servers. Forgetful of many things like coffee, coffee creamers, extra water, sides etc, on more than a few visits day/night.  Some have  a bit of that Midwest "Flo" diner waitress (for way too long) attitude.   Food-wise, the hash browns have been undercooked on more than one occasion and the gravy tends to be a bit cold.   Music is a little loud for the space as well.   I'll still be a regular however!

ZUhvgmyEKVlF6wS09__8aA.text: My mom and I decided to go here for brunch after walking around the nearby outlet mall. This place is very easy to find. Decor was minimal but very cute and Bear themed.  We were seated almost immediately and our server Brett took our drink orders. We decided to split "The Grizz" and when our order came to our table, we were both relieved that we decided to split. The order came on two platters. One platter had 2 strips of bacon, 2 sausages, a ham steak, 3 eggs and potatoes on it. The other platter had two sweet cream pancakes bigger than my face. It was pretty impressive. Now, there's not much to say about bacon, eggs and ham. Those are pretty hard to mess up. The sausage was absolutely delicious and juicy! And the potatoes were season perfectly and served with bell pepper and onions. The star of the meal was definitely the pancakes! I will never attempt to make pancakes at home ever again! They were nice and fluffy and perfectly cooked. The dusting of powdered sugar with butter and syrup made it even more delicious!  Our server, Brett was very attentive and made sure our drinks never ran out.  We will definitely be back!

WLDbgEGKxPmsigRFiqyUuQ.text: SHANDI IS THE BOMB-DIGTY! Love her service! I met her daughter as well. SHANDI is so personable and her customer service is awe

Sm8rtlGGCyW8ylFZTteZgw.text: Was introduced to this chain last year and fell in love with it. Food is great and portions are generous but the True stars are the super friendly staff. It's obvious they love where they work.

yLrXaCBjf4bKaeGWtWw6Zg.text: Sat morning was packed, so we came back street the brunch rush at like 2... Wife got breakie and I got the chicken fried steak. She liked the fresh biscuit, I liked the corn bread with honey. The banana creme pie was pretty good too  Good choice if you're on the south end of the strip

MN7uDZXEo9n0ZrMQ3BDj8g.text: Holy cow! This place is a great surprise and my wife & I are super glad we found this place. Great service, festive music and the food was very delicious. My wife had the mini-volcano (eggs, bacon & pancakes) were cooked perfectly, pancakes were very fluffy. I had the Huevos rancheros and man.... It was fully flavored over crispy corn tortillas. Definitely coming back.

o6VLvnqXFZ-nERaABF3fSw.text: This place is great! Reasonably priced and hearty generally natural food. The coffee is really really good for diner coffee.

gDfeY1-cW8CHKtV7EAp16g.text: Excellent food and service. Shantel was a sweetheart. The music is was awesome! Food portion are large with a nice presentation. Prices are very fair. We will return!

RVrO_fREm3eZLssmgfqn1w.text: Decided to try this place for thw forat time for breakfast. It's conveniently located on the south end of the Strip in the outlet shopping center. Our wait time was about twenty minutes which was pretty good for a saturday morning. The reataurant is so cutely decortated with cute black bears, very woodsy feel. We took a look at the menu and it was great, so many choices to make. Our server was Sandor, he was awesome, he was super attentive and met our needs with a smile and a courtesy that is very hard to find. The food was on point and delicious. Tasted very fresh and came out fast. Our breakfast experience was great and will definitely recommend Black Bear Diner a million times over. Thank You!

XmkPP-YqmwkjAas_dSSU8g.text: Great food,service, and atmosphere. Zero complaints from the kiddos too. Looks like we found another "family spot" when we are on this side of town.

S-RnVKJ0tlkAP_B7W7auLg.text: Great service and yummy food. Chicken fried steak 'little less' was plenty. The Asian Chicken Salad was great size. Dessert variety is traditional with a coconut cream pie that was HUGE and in a bowl.

d0jCduJCmHQOPBLCPcwPqA.text: Great service!!!! Outstanding service! Tons of food and love the mountain feeling decor. The food was way more than we thought. Could not see any free space on my plate.This was our second time to a Black Bear. Easy location next to the outlets. Had breakfast with the largest biscuit I have ever seen. Fresh OJ and beef hash. We will be back!

F4n7HJBWR0hTb_Ysgmwjvw.text: The food is awesome here.. once you get it. It seems that every time we have come here it takes over 30-45 mins to get our breakfast and it's a little cold. That's the only reason I didn't get it a 5 star. Other than that- extensive menu and friendly employees.

4h__3xUoT26qsKs-eRR8mw.text: My friend and I took a motorcycle ride to just have an adventure day. we stopped in the town of Cottonwood AZ. Neither of us had ever been to the Black  Bear Diner but decided to give it a go. We were greeted by a Jason who was so pleasant and welcoming..escorted to our table  and gave us our introduction to Black Bear and what makes it special. Our server "Marcus" was simply amazing...He was very friendly and had the best sense of humor (as we two old ladies can be a hand full). The food was plentiful and delicious and the service was above and beyond. Definitely will be visiting again it was so refreshing to have such a wonderful experience. Great food and thanks to Marcus fantastic service at such reasonable prices! It just made our "adventure" day even more fun!!!

Hv48TVpU9VV0sWLSCpZ76g.text: I work in the restaurant business and the most important thing to me is customer service and first impression... let me tell you this place has it. As far as the food it's your typical breakfast food nothing out of the ordinary and definitely not bad either!!! The staff was super nice and made sure that we were helped! However I believe our servers name was Zoe she was awesome! Friendly face and made sure we had what we needed! If not for the food we'd come back for the friendly staff!!!

pE6mHSH6WWchjgKFKqNIUQ.text: This place is amazing.  Food potions are large and service was excellent.  A bit of of a wait but not bad.   Would definitely come back the next time we are in the area.

5sWJ99E6oHYPqgXvJDRM_A.text: I eat at this place at least once every two weeks. Overall I've had good experiences. Recently, I sat at the counter and Brett was my server.
